sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on objectIDLen could lead to buffer overflow

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on initialDataLen could lead to buffer overflow

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Unencrypted output to Normal World if the created object is later accessed by untrusted components

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Potential for memory corruption if a tainted pointer is passed that does not match a valid allocation.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Missing input validation for size parameter could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Destination buffer may point to shared memory accessible by Normal World

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access

sinks.name: TEE_OpenPersistentObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: TEE_OpenPersistentObject
sinks.reason: Shared memory operations could allow tainted data to affect shared objects, especially with sharing permissions.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Buffer could be shared with Normal World, leading to exposure of potentially tainted data.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: strcmp
sinks.reason: Input string may be tainted, leading to potential misuse in subsequent operations.

sinks.name: strcmp
sinks.reason: Input string may be tainted, leading to potential misuse in subsequent operations.

sinks.name: strlen
sinks.reason: Missing input validation could lead to undefined behavior if a tainted pointer is passed.

sinks.name: strncmp
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access if derived from tainted data.

sinks.name: strtoul
sinks.reason: Missing input validation leading to potential buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access
